message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.LG, cs.SI, cs.CC. 

The paper deals with characterizations of entropy and information loss, which are concepts commonly studied in information theory (cs.IT). The paper also uses concepts from probability theory and functional analysis, which are relevant to data structures and algorithms (cs.DS) and machine learning (cs.LG). The paper's focus on entropy and information loss as measures of information suggests that it may also be relevant to signal processing and information retrieval (cs.SI). Finally, the paper's use of measure-preserving functions suggests that it may be relevant to computational complexity theory (cs.CC).
